column2: The Main gate has been reinforced with timber.
In addition the the reinforced gate, crenulations have been added to the walls.
In addition the the reinforced gate and crenulations, 2 towers have been added to the gate.
In addition the the reinforced gate, crenulations, and towers, the outer grounds have been laced with traps.
In addition the the reinforced gate, crenulations, towers, and traps, a moat an draw bridge have been constructed.

The central plains of the Anin and traditional meeting ground of the tribes. As such Anin tribes hold it sacred and any Tribe Potent who holds it has a strong claim for leadership of the tribes.
The stone castle of the Gap, constructed from the remains of an Old City that once housed the Ancients.
The stone Gawei castle, it's keep seated partway up the Hal Mountains. The approching stairway is carved black stone and the center stone is red.
The stone castle of Jese, it's built between the tributaries of the Jese river and even bends the rivers around itself as they flow together.
The stone castle-city of Levyt, it's built on a small island in the mouth of the Levyt river and has long protected the Levytans from outside threats..
The stone castle of Silt, built by the greatest architects of the renowned builders, the Navo, it bridges the Navo river and encompasses it source, the Niya Falls.
The stone hall of the Abimelech, the early conquered were forced to build it, crafting it from their villages and adourning with their fallen.
The Coral castle in Etzu Lake.
The Grey-Tribes have long been master forgers, as such their wares are highly demanded in Goshen.
The forged metal walls of the Grey-Tribes.
The Bottomless hole in the deadlands.
The home of the Hunute in their Forest.
The sacred tree in the Basli Forest, said to be the remains of their God, Jaali.
The ancestral home of the first Kalani.
The Kauni Forest, home to the insect mounts, the Kauni, and sacred to the Zet.
One of the Levytan tradeposts, frequented by the Levytan tradeships.
the waterfall, Niya Falls, sacred to the Navo people.
The Wooden fort of Quess, constructed when the Gawei conquered the Ran-nu Peninsula.
The home of the Yavans, the huts are constructed high in the old growth trees of the Yava Forest.
Gawei Village, the ancestral home of the Supreme.
